English: I see everything in pink (I’m optimistic).
Let’s add some colour (make it lively).
Is there a bus to there?

Bulgarian: Кой номер автобус трябва да взема?
Pronunciation: Koy no-mer av-to-bus tryab-va da vze-ma?
English: Which bus number should I take?

Bulgarian: Можете ли да ми покажете на картата?
Pronunciation: Mo-zhe-te li da mi po-ka-zhe-te na kar-ta-ta?
English: Can you show me on the map?
Is there a train to Sofia?
When does the next bus leave?
The potatoes are in the bag.
Do you like fruits and vegetables?
The apple of discord (cause of conflict).

Bulgarian: Доматите са червени, но не винаги сладки.
Pronunciation: Domatite sa cherveni, no ne vinagi sladki.
English: Tomatoes are red, but not always sweet (looks can deceive).

Bulgarian: Една ябълка на ден държи доктора далеч.
Pronunciation: Edna yǎbǎlka na den dǎrzhi doktora dalech.
English: An apple a day keeps the doctor away.
Can I pay with a card?
Can I have the menu, please?
I have a meeting at 3 o'clock.
How many days will you stay?

Bulgarian: Моят рожден ден е през май.
Pronunciation: Mo-yat rozh-den den e prez mai.
